comment: Awesome guy who cares about math and his students a lot! He could explain calculus to a 10-year-old. He knows everyone by name and is very approachable.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: If you email him at any point in the day, you can usually expect a reply back within an hour or so. He's super helpful if you're struggling with something in the class and will go above and beyond if you reach out asking for some help. Just remember to show every bit of work you can, he's very scrutinous about that on tests/quizzes
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I ended up withdrawing from his class because i changed my major, but he has been the most caring professor i've had so far. i emailed him about my struggles in class due to mental health, and he took the time to sit down with me and come up with some tips and ideas to help. he's funny too, and very nerdy. i would take him again, just not for math.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Tough grader

comment: He wasn't a good teacher for math at all. His explanations were easy to understand, but he does one practice problem for each topic. If you wanted more help, he directs you to the book, and the problems in there aren't like what he teaches. I was struggling for so long, and I kept asking about office hours. He wouldn't make the time to meet w/ me
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He puts little effort into his class and its a double standard as he wants bust it for your grade but doesn't put in his part of effort. His grading is terrible, even if you get the right answer but skipped some steps he takes off points. VERY open about being lazy with grading things . 4 tests 1 Final . Replaces lowest with final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Darn fine professor. If you put in the work you will get the grade. Very fair professor and makes class as interesting as a math class can be.
rating_tags: Respected--Caring--Tough grader

comment: If you consistently attend class and study, this professor is for you. He gives you every chance to succeed, as his lectures are clear, and he is very helpful if you pursue him. I definitely recommend if you are self-motivated.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: His teaching style is reading the notes and going over examples with little explanation. The notes are the exam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Terrible. He says he wants us to succeed in his class, but he grades really harshly. The homework is heavy, the exams are heavy, and he takes off points for tiny useless mistakes. He also takes off pints for not showing work the way he wants. I regret taking this class with him because it ruined my GPA and I will most likely lose the hope scholars.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: NOT an easy A, you'll have to work for it. provides notes to print off before class so you can follow along and fill it out as you go. Tests/quizzes are HARD. His study guides let you know the topics to know before a test, but FIND/LEARN THE HARDEST EXAMPLES IN THE BOOK if you want to get an A on the test. He's funny, nice, has Extra Cred on tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Hard class, but GREAT professor. Attend every class. He puts his note outline for class up online before class and then uploads them after class with his additional writing. Quizzes and Tests are HARD. Study as often as possible and make sure you can do the hardest examples from the book if you want an A on tests. He does extra credit on all tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Cool guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: This is the biggest mistake you could ever make! He doesn't teach he just reads his notes and assumes you understand and goes way too fast, while also bragging about how bad of a teacher is. His practice problems are nothing like the exams so be prepared to fail every one of them and this class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof Morley is a great guy. He's hilarious and super easy to talk to (ask him about video-games). He does have a tendency to run through his slides too fast , and encourages you to "print them out" instead of writing notes. He loves putting you into groups, which sucks, because he picks them. All said, he is a super cool guy, and a great teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: He was a great professor, but his pace is pretty fast. If you are not familiar with calculus do not take this class. He grades based on your steps to get an answer and sometimes has issues properly explaining some of his methods. Overall, a fun teacher though.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Grades on the work not if you got the answer correct. He believes his form of doing problems is the only way so either adjust or he will fail you I got the answer right almost everytime, but when I would question him he would say "but your notation is wrong and my way is the way to do it." Overall caring about students but cannot teach them.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved taking Prof Morley's class. To some, he is hard on grading (this is for students that haven't taken math in a long time) but as a student from HS the class was everything I expected but the Prof made things easier and is extremely transparent on policies and what the exam/quiz will require and when.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Morley is a great professor. He really knows whats hes talking about. He has fairly easy test. However, his class does require a lot of studying. He is always willing to help. I cant count how many times we met during his office hours and he never minded a bit.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Don't. Just don't. You are better off taking your required math class a different semester. This class tanked my gpa. None of the class test averages went above a 75%. His tests have the hardest problems only on them and he grades really hard. If you don't even show 4/14, you will get points off. He doesn't stick to his office hours either. BEWARE
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: I am taking him as a freshman. He is really nice and cares about his students. But he is very unorganized, he does try new techniques to help but he procrastinates a lot. His tests are really hard but he does have office hours. He's nice but I wouldn't take him again just because I personally need a better teaching technique.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is a great guy and you can tell he cares about his students, However the tests are nothing like the study guides and only certain parts of the study guide are actually on the test. You must show all steps of your work to receive full credit
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: I am taking his class right now. He is a very good teacher. His notes make a lot of sense and if he realizes that he might be talking about something none of us know, he will side note and explain for us. He is very straight forward. Emails you back almost immediately. I recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Mr. Morley is a great teacher! Only complaint is he didn't do a review of College Algebra in the beginning of the class. Being that I haven't taken a college algebra class for 10 yrs it was a little tough for me. He is straight to the point and you must show work! Quizzes are open notes/book. It's a math class so if you miss class you are behind!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a very clear grader and his notes are straight forward. He posts the notes and study guides online but I would recommend going to class to understand everything on the notes. You get partial credit on tests for just showing your work. This was my first math class in 4 years and he made it VERY easy to pick up and follow along.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: makes math very hard- worst professor I've had and he intentionally brings you down.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: The class moves fast since there is so much material that needs to be covered. He replaced the lowest test grade with the final exam grade. I had not taken a math class in over 6 years but as long as you do all of the homework and pay attention in class, you'll do fine.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Very nice guy, he is still new on instructing. He will help you in anyway he can. His study guides are tricky, but make sure to look over all formulas. He doesn't count attendance, but if you skip class and instructions, you will probably not do well. His tests/exams are extremely hard!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Great guy who will really try to help you out if you don't understand something. No attendance policy but there is a lot of homework and quizzes so I would recommend going to class but if you still decide not to, he post the dates of the quizzes and test online so you can be ready.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Morely is super cool and nice! He really can teach well and answers questions great! He allows open notes on quizzes. Test are pretty hard and he is a tough grader. MUST SHOW WORK on every question or you don't get full credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: lots of online homework, great at answering questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Morley is a really good teacher. If you're not that good at math, you should take him. He is patient with you, and he always leaves his office hours open for you. However, we do take ALOT of quizzes and 4 test. We also have ALOT of homework.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY
